= Prerequisite =
Thanks for your consideration to contribute to the project, 
we assumed that you have gone through the [Design] document 
and have basic understanding of the design of the Form Builder plugin 
prior to reading this document.

= How To Create New Field In 3 Steps =
1. Mock up the design of the new field and it's Field Settings tab in static html file. You can start with [http://code.google.com/p/jquery-form-builder-plugin/source/browse/trunk/src/templates/field-design-template.html Field Design Template] and refer to the [http://code.google.com/p/jquery-form-builder-plugin/source/browse/trunk/src/PlainText.html Plain Text field mock up].
2. Create the new field JavaScript file. You can start with [http://code.google.com/p/jquery-form-builder-plugin/source/browse/trunk/src/templates/jquery.formbuilder.field.template.js jQuery Form Builder Field Template] and refer to the [http://code.google.com/p/jquery-form-builder-plugin/wiki/fbWidgetPluginAPI fbWidget API documentation] and [http://code.google.com/p/jquery-form-builder-plugin/source/browse/trunk/src/js/jquery.formbuilder.plaintext.js Plain Text field] implementation.
3. Integrate the new field to [http://code.google.com/p/jquery-form-builder-plugin/source/browse/trunk/src/js/jquery.formbuilder.core.js form builder core plugin] by update fields property at line 17 with value you specified in `options._type` property. Done! You are ready to test drive the new field created by you.
